meanings.definition: The act of compacting or the state of being compacted.
meanings.sent1: The compactions of the soil made it hard to dig.
meanings.sent2: The compactions in the trash bin were difficult to separate.
meanings.sent3: The compactions in the suitcase made it impossible to close.
meanings.sent4: The compactions of thoughts in his mind felt suffocating.
meanings.sent5: The compactions of snow on the road caused slippery conditions.

meanings.sent1: The construction worker removed the compactions of dirt from the site.
meanings.sent2: The compactions of garbage in the bin smelled terrible.
meanings.sent3: The compactions of clothes in the drawer made it hard to find anything.
meanings.sent4: The compactions of ice in the freezer were difficult to break apart.
meanings.sent5: The compactions of books on the shelf made it look neat and organized.
